definitions: psychiatric disorder characterized by adult sexual attraction to prepubescent children, classified as a paraphilia
illegal sexual conduct involving minors, constituting serious criminal offense
examples: The psychiatrist specialized in treating individuals diagnosed with pedophilia
Research into pedophilia focuses on prevention and therapeutic intervention
Law enforcement agencies coordinate internationally to combat pedophilia crimes
Internet monitoring systems help detect and prevent pedophilia activities

definitions: informal term for urine expelled from the body
colloquial expression for the act of urinating
examples: The toddler announced she needed to pee urgently
Dogs mark their territory with their pee scent
He took a quick pee break during the road trip
The bathroom sign indicated where to go for a pee

definitions: brief or furtive look at something partially hidden
preliminary viewing or sampling of something before full revelation
examples: She took a peek through the curtains at the visitors
The children sneaked a peek at their Christmas presents
Get an exclusive peek at next season's fashion collection
The trailer offers a peek into the upcoming movie

definitions: outer skin or rind of fruits and vegetables
act of removing outer layer from something
cosmetic procedure removing dead skin cells for rejuvenation
examples: Orange peel contains aromatic oils used in cooking
Banana peel can be surprisingly slippery when stepped on
She carefully began to peel the protective film off
The paint started to peel after years of weather exposure
The chemical peel improved her skin texture significantly
Dermatologists recommend gentle peels for sensitive skin types

definitions: material coming off in thin layers or flakes
ongoing process of removing outer layers from something
examples: The peeling paint on the old house needed immediate attention
Sunburn resulted in uncomfortable peeling of her shoulders
Peeling vegetables became her least favorite kitchen task
The careful peeling of labels requires patience and technique

definitions: quiet high-pitched sound made by birds or small animals
brief or secretive look at something
examples: The baby chicks made soft peep sounds in their nest
Not a peep was heard from the sleeping children
She took a peep at the surprise party preparations
A peep through the keyhole revealed the empty room

definitions: person of equal standing, age, or social status
member of nobility holding hereditary or life title
act of looking closely or with difficulty at something
examples: The study compared students with their academic peers nationwide
Peer pressure significantly influences teenage behavior and choices
The peer was appointed to the House of Lords
British peers traditionally held significant political influence
She had to peer through the fog to see ahead
He peered at the fine print without his glasses

definitions: system or body of peers collectively in a country
rank or dignity of being a peer
book listing peers and their genealogies
examples: The British peerage includes dukes, marquesses, and earls
Hereditary peerage passes through family lines by primogeniture
He was elevated to the peerage for his public service
The peerage brought both privilege and responsibility
Burke's Peerage contains detailed aristocratic family histories
Researchers consulted the peerage for genealogical information

definitions: wooden or metal pin used for hanging or securing things
fixed point or level used as reference or standard
forceful throw of an object, especially in sports
examples: She hung her coat on the wooden peg by the door
Tent pegs must be driven deep for stability
Interest rates were pegged at five percent annually
The currency peg maintained economic stability
The fielder's peg to first base was perfectly accurate
He took a peg at the target from twenty yards

definitions: large waterbird with distinctive throat pouch for catching fish
examples: Pelicans glided gracefully over the coastal waters
The brown pelican is Louisiana's official state bird

definitions: small rounded compressed mass of substance
small projectile fired from air guns or shotguns
compressed feed given to animals or livestock
examples: Wood pellets provide efficient heating for many homes
The medication comes in small pellet form
The air rifle uses lead pellets for target practice
Shotgun pellets spread in a pattern when fired
Rabbit pellets provide balanced nutrition for pet rabbits
Fish pellets float on the pond surface

definitions: skin of an animal with fur or hair still attached
continuous heavy striking or bombardment with objects
act of moving or running at full speed
examples: Trappers sold beaver pelts to European traders
The museum displayed pelts from various arctic animals
Rain began to pelt against the windows violently
Protesters pelted the building with eggs and tomatoes
The children pelted down the street after the ice cream truck
She pelted toward the finish line with determination

definitions: instrument for writing or drawing with ink
enclosed area for keeping animals confined
adult female swan in ornithological terminology
examples: She signed the contract with her favorite fountain pen
The pen is mightier than the sword, they say
The sheep were herded into the pen for shearing
The pig pen needed cleaning after the storm
The pen swam gracefully beside her cygnets
Male swans are cobs while females are pens

definitions: punishment imposed for breaking law, rule, or contract
disadvantage imposed in sports for rule violation
financial charge for late payment or contract breach
examples: The penalty for tax evasion includes fines and imprisonment
Death penalty debates continue in many jurisdictions
The referee awarded a penalty kick for the handball
The team received a five-yard penalty for false start
Credit card companies charge penalty fees for late payments
Early withdrawal penalties apply to most retirement accounts

definitions: religious act of repentance for sins through prayer or self-punishment
voluntary self-punishment or hardship endured as expression of repentance
examples: The priest assigned penance after hearing her confession
Medieval pilgrims undertook penance for spiritual purification
He did penance for his harsh words by apologizing publicly
Years of community service became her penance for past mistakes

definitions: strong natural liking or tendency toward something particular
examples: She had a penchant for collecting vintage jewelry
His penchant for spicy food was well known among friends

definitions: writing instrument with graphite core encased in wood
cosmetic implement for outlining or coloring features
narrow beam or ray of light or radiation
examples: Students must bring number two pencils for the exam
The artist sketched the portrait with charcoal pencils
She carefully applied the eyeliner pencil before mascara
Lip pencil helps prevent lipstick from bleeding
A pencil of light shone through the crack
The pencil beam focused precisely on the target

definitions: piece of jewelry hanging from chain worn around neck
hanging ornamental feature in architecture or decoration
one of matching pair or complementary counterpart
examples: The diamond pendant sparkled on her gold necklace
Her grandmother's pendant held deep sentimental value
Gothic cathedrals feature ornate pendant decorations on ceilings
The pendant keystone completed the architectural design
This painting serves as pendant to its companion piece
The pendant volumes complete the encyclopedia set

definitions: weight suspended from fixed point that swings back and forth under gravity
recurring shift between opposite extremes in opinion or situation
examples: The grandfather clock's pendulum regulated its timekeeping mechanism
Foucault's pendulum demonstrates Earth's rotation
The political pendulum swung from liberal to conservative
Fashion's pendulum oscillates between minimalism and maximalism

definitions: act of entering or piercing through barrier or surface
successful entry into market or establishment of market presence
deep understanding or insight into complex matter
examples: Bullet penetration tests measure armor effectiveness
Water penetration caused significant structural damage
Market penetration strategies focus on existing customer bases
The company achieved twenty percent penetration in Asia
Her penetration of the subject impressed the committee
Deep penetration of complex theories requires dedicated study

definitions: device or tool designed to pierce through materials
military projectile designed to penetrate armor or bunkers
company or product entering established market
examples: The concrete penetrator drilled through reinforced walls
Specialized penetrators test material durability
Bunker penetrators can reach deeply buried targets
The armor penetrator defeated enemy tank defenses
New penetrators in the tech market face established competition
Market penetrators must offer unique value propositions

definitions: black and white flightless seabird adapted for swimming in cold waters
examples: Emperor penguins endure Antarctica's harshest winter conditions
The penguin colony huddled together for warmth

definitions: antibiotic drug derived from mold used to treat bacterial infections
examples: Penicillin revolutionized treatment of bacterial infections worldwide
The patient was allergic to penicillin and needed alternatives

definitions: piece of land surrounded by water on three sides connected to mainland
examples: The Iberian Peninsula includes Spain and Portugal
Florida forms a large peninsula extending into the Atlantic

definitions: feeling of sorrow and regret for having done wrong or sinned
examples: His penitence for past mistakes seemed genuine and heartfelt
The letter expressed deep penitence for the harm caused

definitions: person feeling or showing sorrow for wrongdoing
person doing penance or seeking absolution in religious context
examples: The penitent thief asked for forgiveness before sentencing
She appeared genuinely penitent about her harsh words
Penitents lined up for confession before Easter Sunday
Medieval penitents wore rough clothing as sign of repentance

definitions: large prison for convicted criminals serving long sentences, especially federal prison
examples: He was sentenced to twenty years in the federal penitentiary
The maximum-security penitentiary housed dangerous offenders

definitions: person skilled in handwriting or calligraphy, especially professionally
examples: The penman created beautiful wedding invitations by hand
Historical documents required skilled penmen for official copies

definitions: art or skill of writing by hand with style and legibility
examples: Her excellent penmanship made her notes easy to read
Schools once devoted hours to teaching proper penmanship

definitions: long triangular flag typically used for signaling or decoration
championship title in sports leagues, especially baseball
examples: Colorful pennants decorated the yacht club for the regatta
Naval ships flew pennants to communicate with other vessels
The team won the pennant after a thrilling playoff race
Championship pennants hung proudly in the stadium

definitions: tube-shaped pasta cut diagonally at both ends
examples: Penne pasta holds sauce well in its ridged tubes
She ordered penne arrabbiata at the Italian restaurant

definitions: act of writing or composing literary works
process of confining animals in enclosures
examples: She spent the afternoon penning letters to old friends
The author was busy penning her next novel
Penning the sheep took hours during shearing season
Cowboys practiced penning cattle for the rodeo

definitions: bronze coin worth one cent in American currency
very small amount of money used metaphorically
examples: She found a lucky penny on the sidewalk
The penny has Lincoln's portrait on one side
Every penny counts when saving for college
He didn't have a penny to his name

definitions: amount that can be bought for penny or small sum
examples: He didn't get his pennyworth from that purchase
A pennyworth of candy delighted the children

definitions: regular payment made to retired person from employer or government
small hotel or boarding house, especially in Europe
examples: Her pension provides steady income during retirement years
The company froze pension benefits for new employees
They stayed at a charming pension in the Alps
The family-run pension offered breakfast and dinner

definitions: person receiving regular pension payments, especially in retirement
examples: Pensioners received cost-of-living adjustments this year
The club offers special discounts for pensioners

definitions: geometric figure with five straight sides and angles
headquarters building of United States Department of Defense
examples: Students learned to draw perfect pentagons in geometry class
A regular pentagon has equal sides and angles
The Pentagon announced new defense spending priorities
Officials met at the Pentagon to discuss strategy

definitions: five-pointed star formed by extending lines of regular pentagon
examples: The pentagram appeared in ancient religious symbolism
Wiccans use the pentagram as a protective symbol

definitions: line of verse consisting of five metrical feet in poetry
examples: Shakespeare wrote many sonnets in iambic pentameter
The poem's pentameter created a rhythmic flow

definitions: athlete who competes in pentathlon consisting of five different events
examples: The pentathlete trained in swimming, running, and fencing
Modern pentathletes must master diverse athletic skills

definitions: athletic contest consisting of five different events for each competitor
examples: The modern pentathlon includes fencing, swimming, and shooting
She won gold in the pentathlon at the Olympics

definitions: Christian religious movement emphasizing direct personal experience with God through baptism
examples: Pentecostalism emphasizes speaking in tongues and divine healing
The church practiced pentecostalism with enthusiastic worship services

definitions: expensive apartment on top floor of tall building with luxury features
examples: The penthouse offered panoramic views of the city skyline
Celebrity penthouses often feature private elevators and terraces

definitions: occurring immediately before the last one in series or sequence
examples: The penultimate chapter revealed the murderer's identity
They reached the penultimate stage of the competition

definitions: partially shaded region around complete shadow during eclipse
area of uncertainty or ambiguity at edges of something
examples: The moon passed through Earth's penumbra during the eclipse
Observers in the penumbra saw a partial solar eclipse
Constitutional rights exist in the penumbra of explicit amendments
The penumbra between legal and illegal remains contested

definitions: large fragrant flower with showy blooms in various colors
examples: Pink peonies bloomed magnificently in the spring garden
The bride carried a bouquet of white peonies

definitions: lively energy, vigor, or high spirits in personality or performance
examples: The coach's pep talk motivated the team before the game
She had extra pep in her step after the good news

definitions: pungent spice made from dried peppercorns used for seasoning
plant producing hot or sweet pods eaten as vegetables
small projectiles or marks scattered over surface
examples: Black pepper adds flavor to almost any savory dish
Freshly ground pepper tastes better than pre-ground
Bell peppers come in red, yellow, and green varieties
Hot peppers require careful handling when cooking
Buckshot peppered the side of the old barn
Freckles peppered her nose and cheeks

definitions: dried berry of pepper plant ground to make pepper spice
examples: Whole peppercorns retain flavor longer than ground pepper
The recipe called for crushed pink peppercorns

definitions: aromatic plant with menthol-flavored leaves used in medicine and cooking
candy or flavoring with strong mint taste from peppermint oil
examples: Peppermint tea soothes upset stomachs naturally
Fresh peppermint grew abundantly in the herb garden
Peppermint candies freshened breath after dinner
The peppermint mocha became a holiday favorite
